034f5fe8494097bb274500182f17ebfc (15:10): anyone using triggers with mysql 5.0.24a ?  if so, do you notice that opening tables/closing tables happens on tables that are updated from a trigger .. even tho table_cache_size is set high enough?
034f5fe8494097bb274500182f17ebfc (15:26): can anyone think of a way to detect if a row exists in a before insert trigger?
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:28): i got a really weird problem here
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:28): i'm accessing mysql via the 3.51 odbc driver
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:28): i do something like: SELECT (FIELD1||FIELD2) AS X FROM tbl;
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:28): FIELD1 and FIELD2 a VARCHARS
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:29): but in my ado.net dataset, only int values are acepted
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:29): is there any way to declare X a VARCHAR during the query?
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (15:30): !wench status
c02bf0b312fb046849b1cc7cf4e9a963 (15:30): I have 4234 mysql factoids
034f5fe8494097bb274500182f17ebfc (15:32): archivist, do you use triggers in mysql?
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (15:32): no

034f5fe8494097bb274500182f17ebfc (15:33): archivist, for some reason... triggers that update another table.. don't respect the table cache... i get "opening tables" .. "closing tables" ... all day long :(
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (15:33): keyword there is update
034f5fe8494097bb274500182f17ebfc (15:34): yeah but if you have table cache to be 500 shouldn't the trigger obey the cache?  opening/closing tables wastes so much
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (15:36): switch on delayed write (or whatever its called)
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (15:38): if you wish to allow the possible data loss on a crash/power loss
1131e95d5c00131bed6776623990b2a1 (15:43): i select rows from 2 tables that have a 1:n relation. How do i know what will happen if i group by the first table?
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:43): || means concatenate, right?
1131e95d5c00131bed6776623990b2a1 (15:44): i dont know about ODBC
1131e95d5c00131bed6776623990b2a1 (15:44): in mysql it would be CONCAT(field1,field2)
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:45): i'll try that
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:46): works
f7e6971dbbdfff2fb82151f934d183a6 (15:46): thanks

7e4a8313e99729c4bdbd111655a15c6e (16:14): and there i get that error message
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:14): a quick question i have Some fields like Firstname or Lastname in my table do i make them varchar or char ?
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:15): i'd use varchar
7e4a8313e99729c4bdbd111655a15c6e (16:15): alter table
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:15): than I wont be able to use char at other fields
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:15): it says: Using both a CHAR and VARCHAR option in the same table, MySQL will automatically change the CHAR into VARCHAR for compatability reasons
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:15): so my chars will go to varchar
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:15): well, does it matter? :)
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:16): will be a very big database.
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:16): char performance is better
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:17): so what's the actual question then?  you seem to already know all the answers
1131e95d5c00131bed6776623990b2a1 (16:17): CalvadoS: its size vs. performance
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:17): no i dont know i say what i read.
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:18): well I've a field *with fixxed size* I want to use it as char. and i have firstname and lastname fields that they dont have fixxed size
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:18): do I matter if I make them char(25) ? dont know any firstname or lastname longer than 30
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:19): if you make 'em char(25), then every name you put in will take up 25 (26 maybe?) bytes (for non unicode columns)
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:19): if you make 'em varchar(25) they will take up length(name)+1
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:20): which one performance will be better ? because there is alot of fixxed size that I need to use char on fields.
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:20): if I put them varchar that seems better i will lose other
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:20): fixed performance is better
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:21): hmm than had better to char(35) thanks
8d01208ecab9e1bb050c9325f13e32af (16:32): clear
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:35): I have costs in a table like 0.2066 0.1066 214.2066 what is the best datatype than ?
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (16:35): if money then decimal
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:36): yes its money
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:36): do I need to give a number after decimal(?) it seems there is a (,) in it.
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:37): !man decimal
c02bf0b312fb046849b1cc7cf4e9a963 (16:37): See http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/data-types.html
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (16:39): the bot has had an upgrade to todays version of the 5.0 manual
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:40): if I make 16,2 does 0.2066 number rounds to 0.21 when im inserting ?
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:40): or it fails to insert
bbe14fdac8128cdd0ab85e59a27e88d4 (16:40): my guess is that it is truncated to 0.20
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:40): ignore it I'll try before you paste another url :)
bf3302d057c10c59c6d4cee9270c6892 (16:41): aloha my friends
bbe14fdac8128cdd0ab85e59a27e88d4 (16:41): MySQL performs rounding when storing values, so if you insert 999.00009 into a FLOAT(7,4)  column, the approximate result is 999.0001
bf3302d057c10c59c6d4cee9270c6892 (16:42): nothing, at the library doing math ;)
bf3302d057c10c59c6d4cee9270c6892 (16:42): so not that talkative
ab14bd2ee3f91af24d7bbf48a933b8f9 (16:42): decimal should not round try it
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:42): than float is better choice for me. im making rounding at program it can make my program faster when fetching results also at inserting
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:43): float's desc. "is A small number with a floating decimal point." how much small numer ?
2a5d743f3ac28cd9c337b87c32e8883c (16:43): does 5000.9999 is long for it ?
